title: Appreciating Kaldi & The Berries
description: WORKSHOP Appreciating Kaldi & The Berries Appreciating Kaldi & the Berries covers in depth the details of "From Crop to Cup" experience. In this workshop, you will learn everything from history to what happens to the coffee beans as it transforms from a cherry seed to a beverage served in cafes. Workshop Location: Dutch Colony Coffee Co. (Roastery) 127 Defu Lane 10 #02-03 Singapore, 539234 View Map Refund Policy: Refunds up to 7 days before event

title: Dutch
description: BRAZIL & ETHIOPIA Blend | Espresso Cherry. Raisin. Molasses. Milk Chocolate. Brazil Ethiopia : 70% Sabia Mogiana : 30% Gargari Gutity The crowning glory of Dutch Colony, this signature house blend was first formulated in 2013 and in the last 12 years, has gone through numerous blend composition but yet sticking to flavours that have kept the crowd coming and the home-barista buying! Award winning (winning Silver and Bronze medals in RASV Coffee Roasting competition between 2015 to 2020) and internationally acclaimed blend which is popularly distributed and consumed currently in Brunei, Dubai, Qatar and also Sri Lanka, Dutch blend is balanced, nuanced and produced a delicious cup which is highly recommended for espresso based beverages. Designed to bridge the gap between the flavours of comfort (Brazil) and exoticness (Ethiopian), Dutch Blend allows a consumer new to the specialty coffee world to cross over without feeling the culture shock on the palate. This 2nd version of Dutch Blend

title: Batavia
description: BRAZIL & INDONESIA Blend | Espresso Prune. Molasses. Chocolate Malt.Caramel Milk Brazil Indonesia : 70% Santos Maritaca : 30% Sumatra Mandheling One of our best sellers among out wholesale partners, Batavia blend combines the passion of the roasting team without undermining the needs of the customers that we service. Two classic Java, origins from Brazil and Indonesia, which are rotated between farms during seasonal harvest change, are expertly roasted, with a longer roast development just right before second crack. A bold and neat coffee, not neccessarily 'dark roast' with a hint of molasses and fruits for the added finish. Designed for your milk-based beverages but equally hit the spot even as a shot of espresso or an Americano! Not available on the coffee shelves of our retail shops but a blend so, so good that our wholesale partners keep coming back for more. Join the Batavia party and taste this classic to believe that when Comfort meets Expertly Roasted Beans, the palate sing a s

title: Portafilter Dosing Cup
description: ACAIA Portafilter Dosing Cup Compatible with a 58 mm portafilter, the dosing cup allows for an efficient and tidy transfer between the grinder and your portafilter. It helps baristas achieve a more precise dose with minimal waste. The small size option is Acaia's newest and smallest doing cup that has s horter design than previous dosing cup and new fully circumferencing lip for compatibility with more grinder models. Made if food-grade 304 stainless steel. Anti-static finish to minimize coffee grind residue. Compatible with the Mahlkönig EK43, with a quick slip in and out feature. Allows a fast and efficient transfer of grounds to the portafilter without the use of a dosing funnel.

title: Colonial
description: BRAZIL & INDIA Blend | Espresso Prune. Molasses. Dark Cocoa. Malt. Brazil India : 50% Santos Maritaca : 50% Plantation A Customer’s perennial favourite for its classic chocolate + nutty profile with low acidity. Dutch Colony’s boldest espresso roast in our arsenal, Colonial is the only blend in which the beans are allowed to developed beyond the second crack, with a roast development close to 2 minutes and 45 seconds. title: Soy Milk (1L)
description: BONSOY Soy Milk (1L) In French Bonsoy means good soybeans. Created by Japanese soy masters and perfected over many centuries, Bonsoy is a truly healthy and nutritious drink. Only whole organically grown non-genetically modified soybeans are used. The beans are cooked in patented equipment, to ensure the strong beany flavour is eliminated. Tapioca syrup and Job's Tears are added to bring out the natural roasted flavor creating a natural, full bodied mellow aroma with a subtle, mildly sweet flavour. Ingredients: Water, Organic Whole Soybeans (min. 14%), Tapioca Syrup, Sea Salt, Job’s Tear (Hato Mugi), Calcium Carbonate.

title: Lunar Carrying Case
description: ACAIA Lunar Carrying Case The Acaia Lunar Carrying Case is a travel case for your Lunar scale, designed to carry the scale, 100g Calibration Weight, and USB cord. Providing protection for its contents, the Lunar Carrying Case allows you to take the accuracy and precision of the Acaia Lunar in your suitcase or backpack, wherever you go. The minimal and fitted design provides essential protection for your Lunar as you travel and takes up no extra space. This means you can brew a great cup of coffee anywhere while still traveling light. Calibration Reminder: Scale calibration changes with variations in local gravity, surface tilt, and atmospheric conditions. Travel means all three must be considered. We recommend allowing the scale to rest, out of the case and in the location it will be used, before calibrating and using your Lunar after travel. Customised for the Acaia Lunar Eva foam interior absorbs shock during travel Features a mesh storage compartment Flap separates scale and accesso

title: Roaster's Choice Ongoing Subscription
description: ROASTER'S CHOICE ONGOING SUBSCRIPTION Ongoing Subscription | Single Origin Roaster's Choice Ongoing Subscription is a monthly subscription plan that works just like the other ongoing subscription plan where you get on the plan, stay as long as you wish, and suspend or stop the plan any time you want. While the regular Ongoing Subscription plan requires you to select a particular coffee in our offering and to receive the same coffee according to your subscription preferences, subscribers of Roaster's Choice Ongoing Subscription plan will receive unique and seasonal single origin coffee, thoughtfully curated and roasted by our roaster, just for subscribers on this plan only. The coffee is roasted such that it is is perfect for those who enjoy preparing their coffee as a manual pour-over, plunging it through the French Press or like our Coffee Roaster, running it as a lighter roast espresso based beverage! This plan allows the subscribers to experience different coffee throughout the year

title: Pearl Carrying Case
description: ACAIA Pearl Carrying Case Protect your Pearl on the go. Designed exclusively for our Acaia Pearl series, this protective carrying case is an essential for both professional and home baristas who brew on their travels or between different locations. The minimal and fitted design provides important protection for your Pearl and Pearl Model S wherever you go, without taking up extra space. Enjoy brewing with ease and precision no matter where you are. Please note that while the case provides protection from other objects, sudden accelerations or shocks may still damage your precision scale. Handle any luggage or bag containing sensitive scales with care. Calibration Reminder: Scale calibration changes with variations in local gravity, surface tilt, and atmospheric conditions. Travel means all three must be considered. We recommend allowing the scale to rest, out of the case and in the location it will be used, before calibrating and using your Pearl after travel.

title: Atmos Vacuum Canister
description: FELLOW Atmos Vacuum Canister Guard the goods. Oxygen makes coffee stale and robs your brew of its full potential. Atmos banishes air, moisture, and odors to stop your beans from aging out before you’ve enjoyed the whole bag. Twisting the lid back and forth sucks air out to prevent oxidation and extends coffee’s shelf life up to 50%. Features: 304 18/8 matte white & matte black stainless steel 1.2 Liter canister holds up to 455 g of coffee beans 0.7 Liter canister holds up to 315 g of coffee beans 0.4 Liter canister holds up to 149 g of coffee beans Do not place Atmos upside down while storing content inside Not suitable for dishwasher - the integrated vacuum pump won't like it

title: Carter Move Mug
description: FELLOW Carter Move Mug We never understood why to-go tumblers made design decisions that compromised the coffee drinking experience. The senses–taste, smell, and touch–were ignored, while durability and extreme heat retention were prioritized. Why not both? Meet Carter Move Mug, a travel mug finally worthy of the coffee inside. Designed to amplify the senses and engineered to fit your travel needs with a snap-in splash guard and slim width, you can now enjoy coffee at its fullest on-the-go. title: 53mm Portafilter Dosing Cup
description: ACAIA Portafilter Dosing Cup Compatible with a 53 mm portafilter, the dosing cup allows for an efficient and tidy transfer between the grinder and your portafilter. It helps baristas achieve a more precise dose with minimal waste, as it collects the grounds and transfer it neatly into the basket or brewing device. The 53mm size option is Acaia's newest and smallest dosing cup that has a special ceramic coating which helps to cut down on wasted coffee that get stuck in the cup, also making it easier to keep clean. A mouth diameter to fit a 53 mm portafilter. Made of food-grade 304 stainless steel. Durable ceramic coating to minimise coffee grind residue. Compatible with the Mahlkönig EK43, with a quick slip in and out feature. Allows a fast and efficient transfer of grounds to the portafilter without the use of a dosing funnel.

title: Ode Brew Grinder
description: FELLOW Ode Brew Grinder A powerful and precise home coffee grinder with café capabilities, Ode Brew Grinder does things differently. When grinders try to tackle both brewed coffee and espresso, they become a master of none. In stark contrast, Ode was designed to perfect your daily brewed coffee— AeroPress®, pour-over, French press, cold brew, and more. With 64 mm professional-grade flat burrs, 31 grind settings, and unique single dose loading for maximum bean freshness, Ode is ready to hit the grind running! Thoughtful Features: Single-dose loading Grinds knocker Compact Size 31 grind settings and guide Quiet grinding and automatic stop Usage: Ode is for brewed coffee (AeroPress®, pour-over, electric coffee makers, French press, cold brew, and more) only. It does not grind for espresso. title: Public Cupping Series
description: EVENT Public Cupping Series Public Cupping Series is a coffee cupping events conducted with the objective to allow our outlet's barista and the coffee leadership team to step out of their comfort zone, sharing their passion to the masses about specialty coffee and what it is all about. There will be various theme and focus in each cupping series, just to keep the session interesting and exciting, and we hope it will provide better appreciation of this industry and what we are passionate about to the public. Come and join us for an exciting session! The coffee was grown by smallholder farmers living around the kabele (town) of Muje in Oromia region. Most contributing farmers own less than a hectare of land, and they grow coffee simply as a backyard cash crop. Coffee will usually be interspersed with other subsistence crops, such as sweet potato, mangos and avocados, but there are no other primary cash crops grown in the region. title: Kopi, Coffee & Craft - A Personal Brew Of Singapore's Coffee Soul
description: Author's Words & Synopsis: "Coffee in Singapore is a story of people, tradition, and change. It's the kopitiam uncle pouring kopi with practiced ease, the barista in a specialty café adjusting the grind for the perfect espresso, and the entrepreneur turning a dream into a café. It's a city where old and new sit side by side, where a strong kopi O belongs just as much as a delicate pour-over. Kopi, Coffee & Craft is a personal journey through this world, exploring what coffee means as a drink, a craft, and a way to bring people together. This book is also about what it takes to build a life in coffee. I take you behind the counter and into the daily lives of baristas and café owners, where long hours, early mornings, and an unwavering commitment to quality shape everything they do. I share the discipline, skill, and resilience needed to thrive in this industry, along with my own experiences in the high-stakes world of barista championships, where precision, storytelling, and taste all c

title: Fazenda Samambaia
description: BRAZIL Single Origin | Espresso Red Apple. Nougat. Peanut Butter. Region Varietal Process Altitude : Minas Gerais : Yellow Catucai : Natural & Dried on Patios : 1200 Metres Origin & Terroir The cool, green hills of Sul de Minas provide ideal conditions for coffee growing and produce some of Brazil’s finest beans. The region is known locally as ‘Vertentes’, because it forms a border between two very important basins in Brazil: the Grande River Basin (which runs to the south) and the São Francisco River Basin (which runs to the northeast). Henrique Dias Cambraia, farmer of Fazenda Samambaia, attributes the success of his farm to a combination of various factors, not least: the farm’s geographic location; competent technical management of the plantations, with individualized phytosanitary controls of the planting fields; constant training based on total quality control programs; and, most importantly, the involvement of the whole team that works on the farm. About San Coffee & The Produce

title: Santos Maritaca
description: BRAZIL Single Origin | Espresso Molasses. Chocolate Praline. Roasted Nuts. title: Haru Suke
description: Ethiopia Single Origin | Omni Earl Grey. Plum. Orange Blossom. Region Varietal Process Altitude : SNNPR, Gediyo, Yirgacheffe : Local Landraces & JARC 74 Selections : Natural & Sun-Dried on Raised Beds : 2000 - 2300 Metres This exceptional natural coffee comes from the Haru Suke washing station, located in the village of Haru, nestled within the fertile highlands of the Yirgacheffe district in Ethiopia’s Gedeo Zone. Managed by the dedicated team at Primrose Coffee and Mr. Birhanu Geda, this lot is a collective effort by smallholder farmers who cultivate coffee as a family crop—grown in backyard gardens no larger than one hectare. Coffee trees surround their homes, intercropped with staple fruits like enset (false banana), avocados, and papayas to ensure both food security and supplemental income for the household. After being handpicked at peak ripeness, the cherries are transported to the washing station—a journey that can stretch up to 10km, often on foot, by mule, or on a motorbike.

title: Chikmagalur Giri Ruchi
description: INDIA Single Origin | Espresso Dark Chocolate. Caramel. Sweet Herbs. Region Varietal Process Altitude : Giris, Chikmagalur : Catuai, Chandragiri, SLN 795 : Fully Washed & Dried On Raised Beds : 950 - 1250 Metres Chikmagalur is a single origin regional coffee sourced from a collection of the finest estates, high grown washed Arabica near to Hassan mill, nurtured since the 1870.s Most of these estates are cradled near Giris, Chikmagalur which adjoins the wooded Western Ghats mountain range. This region has been recognized as one of the 12 most eco-sensitive and bio-diverse zones on the planet. Growing 1250 meters above sea level , the coffee is sheltered by two mighty canopies of old jungle trees like Rosewood, White Ceder, Red Ceder, Ficus, Silver Oak etc., and a lower canopy of soft wood trees. Countless fresh water streams flow through the estates and off late, these estates have also become home to a population of wild elephants, with many being born in the coffee estate itself. Each
